alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 9:39AM EST until February 10 at 9:24AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Liberty, Calhoun, Gulf and Franklin Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Blountstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Forest Road 115 in Liberty County at River Styx Campground will flood, isolating access to the site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CST Wednesday /9:15 AM EST Wednesday/ the stage was 18.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CST Wednesday /9:15 AM EST Wednesday/ was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 12.2 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.2 feet on 07/28/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
